reviewText: I was really glad that this movie finally migrated to DVD since my VCR has been toast for years. I've always been a huge CHiPs fan and this reunion movie does not disappoint at all. Its set just about 16 years after the series ended in 1983 and most of the actors are back, lots of action right from the start along with a lot of drama within as well, the ending (don't want to spoil it) is especially edge of your seat. I hope this DVD release might rekindle the fans to bug Warner Brothers to release more of the regular seasons of CHiPs, its been a long time since Season 2 was released...all in all a very worthy buy and as always Amazon has it in stock when every other retailer, online or land-based store does not.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It was really cool to see Jon & Ponch back in action. The story is pretty good with only a few flashback sequences to the original series. Picture and sound quality is good and all we need now is all the original episodes (plus CHiP's 99) on DVD.P.S. When shown on Sky Digital TV in Europe (Fox), their EPG data claims that Jon & Ponch are two Chicago police officers!

reviewText: Reuniting the original cast of the hit t.v. series CHiPs for this made for t.v. movie, ride with Pouch and Jon on the California Highways as they get back together for the first time in almost 15 years.  This movie is filled with all kinds action, drama, and comedy situations, great for anyone who was into this show when it was aired in the late 70's into the 80's.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Anyone who is a CHIPS fan will want to pick up this dvd.  The story line is good bringing you up to speed with all of your favorites, Baker, Ponch, Baricza, Grossman,  Sgt. Getraer, and the some of the others too.  Basically, Ponch returns to the California Highway Patrol (CHP) job as motor cop after a long time off while Jon is a now Captain and Getraer is the CHP Commissioner.  The plot is good ole Chips of yesteryear with Ponch and John on modern bikes chasing the bad guys again.  Brings back memories of the old series and is a great comeback movie.  The DVD is great quality and I'm glad its been upgraded from the old VHS format.
summary: A Must for a CHIPs fan

reviewText: I couldn't believe we managed to find this on DVD, but I am ecstatic. I am a lifelong CHiPs fan, so this is going with the season one and two dvd set. Now if only they would release the other seasons, I would be in bliss. It came in excellent condition. One side note though, this was formatted for tv, and upon initially watching it you may notice some awkward picture formatting on wider screened tv's (as if they are stretching the picture across your tv screen to a slight degree to accommodate screen size), but on the upside, you soon adjust, and stop noticing it as it isn't that intrusive, and you get engrossed in the movie. Also, no real menu options other than to view the tv ad for it. No picture, or sound menu options, so adjusting settings may be necessary for optimal viewing. Honestly, I left my settings the same and soon wasn't even noticing the stretching effect.
summary: Was a gift for me from my fiance.

reviewText: I don't see what's taking them so long to bring this CHiPs reunion movie out on DVD, especially since it was a popular TV movie that lots of people enjoyed watching including myself since it gave us a chance to see Ponch(Erik Estrada)and Jon(Larry Wilcox) reunite after 16 years from disolving their partnership since Wilcox left the show in the Spring of 1982 due to the fact that Wilcox and Estrada didn't get along in real life behind the set, plus it was interesting seeing how much everyone on the show had changed 15 years later after CHiPs cancellation on NBC along with the fact that the action was actually more upgraded and more realistic in this movie than it ever was during CHiPs whole 6-year run on NBC since Jon and Ponch and none of their fellow officers ever used their guns on the series, unlike most other cop shows like ADAM-12, DRAGNET, TJ HOOKER, HUNTER, etc.Unfortunately CHP mechanic Harlan Arliss(Lou Wagner) along with Officers Bonnie Clark(Randi Oakes), Jeb Turner(Michael Dorn), Sindy Cahill(Brianne Leary), or Kathy Linahan(Tina Gayle)were not in this CHiPs reunion movie although it would've been nice if they had been.Additionally, Jon & Ponch's superior officer Joe Getraer(Robert Pine)is now the CHP Commisioner, Jon is now Capt. Baker, Ponch's last partner in the last 3 episodes of CHiPs Bruce Nelson(Bruce Penhall)gets promoted to Sergeant, and Artie Grossman(Paul Linke)gets transferred to investigations, plus Ponch and Jon aren't bachelors anymore living the single life that they had lived on the show since they both settled down and got married since Ponch is now a widower with a kid and Jon is now married to a fellow CHP officer Sandy Baker.In addition, everything else in this movie is a lot more upgraded too like Ponch and Jon used BMW motorcycles instead of the Kawasaki bikes they used in the series, the CHP cruisers are obviously more sophisticated and more upgraded with better equipment, better lightbars since they used '97 and '98 Ford Crown Victoria CHP patrol cars instead of the '77 and '79 Dodge Monacos they used on the series and used the Vision brand lightbars that they still sometimes use today instead of using the squared flimsy looking lightbar they used on the series.Even though CHiPs '99 was quite an upgrade from CHiPs 1977-83 run on NBC, it's just too bad that Jon and Ponch didn't look nearly as good as they did on the series since Ponch is all chunky with gray hair instead of fit with black hair and Jon had wrinkles and grays, although Larry Wilcox didn't look bad for his age, despite the fact that Wilcox isn't young and wrinkle-free anymore.It was also cool seeing Ponch and Jon being shown on the show JUDGE JUDY just before Jon has a fallout with Ponch before Ponch and his partner get rescued by Jon at the end of this movie when Ponch and Jon make up and become friends again.The one thing I had a hard time understanding about CHiPs '99 is why did they decide to name this CHiPs reunion movie "CHiPs '99" instead of "CHiPs '98" or "CHiPs 2000", since CHiPs '99 made its debut on TNT in October of 1998, not in 1999 or the year 2000.Additionally, I found it odd how Jon was a captain all of the sudden in this movie since Jon had so-called left the CHP and moved back to his ranch in Wyoming in the 1982-83 Season when Officer Bobby Nelson(Tom Reilly)had replaced Jon Baker(Larry Wilcox)as Ponch's new partner in the 1982-83 Season of CHiPs, which by the way was the last and final season of CHiPs before declining ratings led to the shows cancellation in the Summer of 1983.But in this movie, Ponch and Jon act almost as if Jon never even left the CHP, yet Jon is a captain all of the sudden, but was only a patrolman throughout the first 5 years of his partnership with Ponch along with the fact that the California Highway Patrol requires anybody who wants to rejoin the CHP to go through the CHP Academy in Sacramento all over again, even if you're a former chippie, which would therefore mean that both Jon and Ponch had to go through the CHP academy all over again before they reunited at Central in the Fall of 1998.In addition to that, even though they used clips from episodes of the CHiPs series in this movie, including clips from CHiPs 6th Season like the "Fast Company" episode when Bruce Nelson becomes a sworn rookie California Highway Patrolman and becomes Ponch's new partner replacing Bruce's big brother/Ponch's previous partner Bobby Nelson, yet in this movie they don't even mention Bobby or even his name, even though Bruce was still in this movie and nearly dies in a motorcycle accident, but I guess the reason why they didn't have or even mention Bobby's name was because nobody really liked Bobby on the show along with the fact that Erik Estrada had a fallout with Tom Reilly since Estrada didn't like Reilly's  work ethic when Reilly got arrested by the CHP's rival(LAPD)for drug possession in early 1983 which resulted in Reilly getting replaced by Penhall as Ponch's new partner in April of 1983.However, Wilcox and Estrada were eventually able to patch up their differences and become friends later on after CHiPs cancellation on NBC, which was how they were able to manage having Estrada and Wilcox do this reunion movie even though Wilcox and Estrada had constant rivalry behind the set during the first 5 seasons of the show.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie is great as not only as a sequel to the series, but as a stand-alone movie itself. I was a fan of the series as a kid in the 70's & 80's, and with the introduction of new series' I gradually drifted  away from CHiPs in syndication, but CHiPs '99 kind of whetted my apitite to  revisit some of the old episodes and "rewatch them for the first  time", and it's been a great ride all around.
summary: Get ready for high speed action . . . CHiPs is back!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: On a scale of 1 to 10, I'll give it a "7". The show brought back some memories of TV when it was truly TV. Not at all like today's poor selection of shows.  It was a worthwhile purchase - if for nothing else, so see Jon and Ponch ride their motors once again.
